intro: Pediomelum aromaticum var. ambiguum, commonly known as the ambiguum variant of the aromatic pediomelum, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing a preference for well-drained soils. It is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa. Due to its ornamental value and aromatic properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
